intro: Phlomoides paohsingensis, commonly known as the Paohsing phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in East Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its slender stems, opposite leaves, and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or purple. It is often found in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
